name: **Calf Island**
description: Calf Island B685-166 Sheet 1 On the Aran side of Aran Sound North, this small island gives shelter to the mooring place for Aranâ€™s modern lifeboat. This is a truly magnificent beast, too large for the lifeboat station that previously served the community here from the land station just NNW. The island is campable, for those for whom privacy is everything. It is grazed by sheep and quite unexpectedly attractive. No water. The landing is at the E end, onto north or south-facing beaches to taste, where an off-lying islet is barely disconnected.
